question: A particle moves in a straight line with constant acceleration. If it covers 40 m in the 5th second and 48 m in the 7th second, what is the acceleration?
solution: Distance in nth second: Sₙ = u + a(n - 0.5). For 5th second: 40 = u + 4.5a. For 7th second: 48 = u + 6.5a. Subtracting: 8 = 2a, so a = 4 m/s²

question: Two point charges +4 μC and -4 μC are placed at points A and B, 6 cm apart. The electric potential at point P on the perpendicular bisector at 4 cm from the line AB is:
solution: For an electric dipole, the potential at any point on the perpendicular bisector is zero because the two charges are equal and opposite, and equidistant from point P. V = kq₁/r₁ + kq₂/r₂ = k(+4μC)/r - k(4μC)/r = 0

question: An ideal gas undergoes a cyclic process ABCA where AB is isothermal, BC is adiabatic, and CA is isochoric. The efficiency of the cycle is 25%. If the temperature at A is 400 K, what is the temperature at B?
solution: Efficiency η = 1 - T_C/T_A. Given η = 0.25, so 0.25 = 1 - T_C/400. Therefore T_C = 300 K. Since BC is adiabatic and connects to isochoric process, T_B = T_C = 300 K

question: The binding energy per nucleon of ²³⁸U is 7.6 MeV and that of ⁴He is 7.1 MeV. The energy released when 1 kg of ²³⁸U undergoes complete fission is approximately:
solution: Energy per fission = (7.6 - 7.1) × 238 = 119 MeV. Number of atoms in 1 kg = (1000/238) × 6.02 × 10²³. Total energy = 119 × 1.6 × 10⁻¹³ × (1000/238) × 6.02 × 10²³ ≈ 5.1 × 10¹³ J

question: A convex lens of focal length 20 cm forms an image at 30 cm from the lens. The object distance is:
solution: Using lens formula: 1/f = 1/v - 1/u. Given f = 20 cm, v = 30 cm. 1/20 = 1/30 - 1/u. Therefore, 1/u = 1/30 - 1/20 = -1/60. So u = -60 cm

question: A circular coil of 200 turns and radius 10 cm carries a current of 2 A. The magnetic field at the center of the coil is:
solution: Magnetic field at center B = (μ₀NI)/(2R). Given N = 200, I = 2 A, R = 0.1 m. B = (4π × 10⁻⁷ × 200 × 2)/(2 × 0.1) = 2.51 × 10⁻³ T

question: A solid sphere of mass 2 kg and radius 0.5 m rolls down an inclined plane of height 5 m. The velocity of the sphere at the bottom is:
solution: For rolling without slipping: mgh = (1/2)mv² + (1/2)Iω². For solid sphere, I = (2/5)mr² and v = rω. Therefore, mgh = (1/2)mv² + (1/2)(2/5)mr²(v²/r²) = (7/10)mv². v = √(10gh/7) = √(10 × 10 × 5/7) = 8.37 m/s

question: A wire of resistance 12 Ω is bent to form a square. The resistance between two opposite corners is:
solution: When bent as a square, each side has resistance 3 Ω. Between opposite corners, two parallel paths exist, each of resistance 6 Ω (two sides in series). Equivalent resistance = (6 × 6)/(6 + 6) = 3 Ω

question: In Young's double slit experiment, the distance between slits is 0.5 mm and the screen is 100 cm away. If the fringe width is 1.2 mm, the wavelength of light used is:
solution: Fringe width β = λD/d. Given β = 1.2 mm, D = 100 cm, d = 0.5 mm. λ = βd/D = (1.2 × 10⁻³ × 0.5 × 10⁻³)/(1) = 6 × 10⁻⁷ m = 600 nm

question: The ratio of the wavelengths of the first line of Lyman series and the first line of Balmer series in hydrogen spectrum is:
solution: For Lyman series (n₁ = 1, n₂ = 2): 1/λ₁ = R(1/1² - 1/2²) = 3R/4. For Balmer series (n₁ = 2, n₂ = 3): 1/λ₂ = R(1/4 - 1/9) = 5R/36. Therefore, λ₁/λ₂ = (5R/36)/(3R/4) = 5/27

question: The escape velocity from the surface of Earth is 11.2 km/s. The escape velocity from a planet whose mass is 4 times and radius is 2 times that of Earth is:
solution: Escape velocity vₑ = √(2GM/R). For the planet: vₑ' = √(2G(4M)/(2R)) = √(4GM/R) = √2 × √(2GM/R) = √2 × vₑ = √2 × 11.2 = 15.8 km/s

question: A coil of 500 turns and area 0.04 m² is placed perpendicular to a magnetic field. If the field changes from 0.1 T to 0.3 T in 0.02 s, the induced EMF is:
solution: Induced EMF ε = -N(dΦ/dt) = -NA(dB/dt). Given N = 500, A = 0.04 m², dB = 0.2 T, dt = 0.02 s. ε = 500 × 0.04 × (0.2/0.02) = 400 V

question: A particle executing SHM has a maximum velocity of 30 cm/s and maximum acceleration of 60 cm/s². The time period of oscillation is:
solution: Maximum velocity vₘₐₓ = Aω and maximum acceleration aₘₐₓ = Aω². Therefore, aₘₐₓ/vₘₐₓ = ω. Given vₘₐₓ = 30 cm/s and aₘₐₓ = 60 cm/s², ω = 60/30 = 2 rad/s. Time period T = 2π/ω = 2π/2 = π s

question: Two identical metal rods A and B are heated to the same temperature. Rod A is cooled in air while rod B is cooled in water. The ratio of their cooling rates is 1:4. If the thermal conductivity ratio is KA:KB = 2:1, the ratio of surface areas is:
solution: Rate of cooling (dQ/dt) is proportional to KAΔθ. Given cooling rate ratio = 1:4 and K ratio = 2:1. Therefore, (KA × AA)/(KB × AB) = 1/4. So (2 × AA)/(1 × AB) = 1/4. Therefore AA/AB = 1/8

question: In an LCR series circuit, R = 300 Ω, L = 0.9 H, C = 2 μF. The circuit is connected to a 200 V, 50 Hz AC source. The impedance of the circuit is:
A force F = (3x² + 2x) N acts on a particle. The work done in moving the particle from x = 0 to x = 2 m is:
solution: Work done W = ∫F·dx = ∫₀²(3x² + 2x)dx = [x³ + x²]₀² = (8 + 4) - 0 = 12 J

question: The current in a forward biased p-n junction diode is 20 mA at 0.6 V. If the voltage is increased to 0.7 V at 300 K, the current becomes (assume η = 2):
solution: Diode equation: I = I₀(e^(eV/ηkT) - 1). I₁/I₂ = e^(e(V₁-V₂)/ηkT). Given I₁ = 20 mA, V₁ = 0.6 V, V₂ = 0.7 V. At 300 K, kT/e = 0.026 V. I₂/20 = e^(0.1/(2×0.026)) = e^1.923 = 4.18. Therefore I₂ = 83.6 mA

question: Water flows through a horizontal pipe of varying cross-section. At a point where the velocity is 2 m/s, the pressure is 80 kPa. At another point where velocity is 4 m/s, the pressure is:
solution: By Bernoulli's equation: P₁ + (1/2)ρv₁² = P₂ + (1/2)ρv₂². Given P₁ = 80 kPa, v₁ = 2 m/s, v₂ = 4 m/s, ρ = 1000 kg/m³. 80000 + (1/2)(1000)(4) = P₂ + (1/2)(1000)(16). 80000 + 2000 = P₂ + 8000. P₂ = 74000 Pa = 74 kPa

question: The work function of a metal is 2.5 eV. When light of wavelength 400 nm is incident on it, the maximum kinetic energy of emitted electrons is:
solution: Energy of photon E = hc/λ = (6.63 × 10⁻³⁴ × 3 × 10⁸)/(400 × 10⁻⁹) = 4.97 × 10⁻¹⁹ J = 3.1 eV. Maximum KE = E - φ = 3.1 - 2.5 = 0.6 eV

question: Two capacitors of capacitance 4 μF and 6 μF are connected in series across a 100 V supply. The charge on each capacitor and the potential difference across the 4 μF capacitor are:
solution: In series, equivalent capacitance C = (4 × 6)/(4 + 6) = 2.4 μF. Charge Q = CV = 2.4 × 100 = 240 μC (same on both). Voltage across 4 μF: V = Q/C = 240/4 = 60 V

question: A particle moves in a circle of radius 2 m with constant speed 4 m/s. The magnitude of average acceleration between two points diametrically opposite is:
solution: Time to reach diametrically opposite point t = πr/v = π(2)/4 = π/2 s. Change in velocity Δv = 2v = 8 m/s (opposite directions). Average acceleration = Δv/t = 8/(π/2) = 16/π m/s². However, considering magnitude of centripetal acceleration change: aₐᵥg = 8/π m/s²

question: A concave mirror of focal length 15 cm forms a real image of an object placed at 45 cm. The magnification is:
solution: Using mirror formula: 1/f = 1/u + 1/v. Given f = -15 cm, u = -45 cm. 1/(-15) = 1/(-45) + 1/v. Therefore 1/v = -1/15 + 1/45 = -2/45. v = -22.5 cm. Magnification m = -v/u = -(-22.5)/(-45) = -0.5

question: A block of mass 5 kg is pulled on a horizontal surface by a force of 30 N at 37° to the horizontal. If coefficient of friction is 0.4, the acceleration of the block is (sin 37° = 0.6, cos 37° = 0.8):
solution: Horizontal component: Fₓ = 30 × 0.8 = 24 N. Vertical: N = mg - Fsin37° = 50 - 18 = 32 N. Friction f = μN = 0.4 × 32 = 12.8 N. Net force = 24 - 12.8 = 11.2 N. Acceleration a = F/m = 11.2/5 = 2.24 m/s² ≈ 1.6 m/s²

question: A radioactive substance has a half-life of 10 days. The time taken for 75% of the sample to decay is:
solution: After 75% decay, 25% remains, which means N = N₀/4. Using N = N₀(1/2)^(t/T₁/₂): 1/4 = (1/2)^(t/10). Therefore (1/2)² = (1/2)^(t/10), giving t/10 = 2, so t = 20 days

question: The ratio of amplitudes of electric and magnetic fields in an electromagnetic wave in vacuum is:
solution: In electromagnetic waves, E₀/B₀ = c where c is the speed of light in vacuum = 3 × 10⁸ m/s

question: The mean kinetic energy of a molecule of an ideal gas at 300 K is 6.21 × 10⁻²¹ J. What is the mean kinetic energy at 600 K?
solution: Mean kinetic energy of a molecule is directly proportional to absolute temperature: KE = (3/2)kT. At 600 K, KE = 6.21 × 10⁻²¹ × (600/300) = 12.42 × 10⁻²¹ J

question: A current of 5 A flows through a conductor for 2 minutes. The total charge that flows is:
A steel rod of length 1 m at 20°C is heated to 120°C. If the coefficient of linear expansion is 12 × 10⁻⁶ /°C, the change in length is:
Two particles of masses 2 kg and 3 kg are at positions (1, 2, 3) m and (3, 1, 2) m respectively. The position of their centre of mass is:
A sound wave has frequency 500 Hz and wavelength 0.66 m. The velocity of sound is:
solution: Velocity v = fλ = 500 × 0.66 = 330 m/s

question: A car moving with speed 72 km/h approaches a stationary observer. If the frequency of the horn is 400 Hz and speed of sound is 340 m/s, the apparent frequency heard is:
solution: Source moving towards stationary observer: f' = f × v/(v - vₛ). Given vₛ = 72 km/h = 20 m/s, f = 400 Hz, v = 340 m/s. f' = 400 × 340/(340 - 20) = 400 × 340/320 = 425 Hz

question: A proton moving with velocity 2 × 10⁶ m/s enters a magnetic field of 0.5 T at 30° to the field. The magnetic force on the proton is:
solution: Magnetic force F = qvBsinθ. Given q = 1.6 × 10⁻¹⁹ C, v = 2 × 10⁶ m/s, B = 0.5 T, θ = 30°. F = 1.6 × 10⁻¹⁹ × 2 × 10⁶ × 0.5 × 0.5 = 8 × 10⁻¹⁴ N

question: An AC source of 200 V, 50 Hz is connected to a resistor of 100 Ω and an inductor of 0.5 H in series. The power consumed in the circuit is:
A ball of mass 0.2 kg moving with velocity 10 m/s collides elastically with another ball of mass 0.3 kg at rest. The velocity of the first ball after collision is:
solution: For elastic collision: v₁ = [(m₁ - m₂)/(m₁ + m₂)]u₁. Given m₁ = 0.2 kg, m₂ = 0.3 kg, u₁ = 10 m/s. v₁ = [(0.2 - 0.3)/(0.2 + 0.3)] × 10 = (-0.1/0.5) × 10 = -2 m/s

question: The electric potential at a distance of 30 cm from a point charge of 10 nC is:
solution: Electric potential V = kq/r = (9 × 10⁹ × 10 × 10⁻⁹)/(0.3) = 90/0.3 = 300 V

question: A projectile is fired at 30° to the horizontal with velocity 40 m/s. The maximum height reached is (g = 10 m/s²):
In Young's double slit experiment with monochromatic light, the distance between slits is doubled and distance of screen is halved. The fringe width becomes:
solution: Fringe width β = λD/d. When d becomes 2d and D becomes D/2: β' = λ(D/2)/(2d) = (λD)/(4d) = β/4. Therefore fringe width becomes one-fourth

question: Two coils have mutual inductance of 0.5 H. If current in one coil changes from 2 A to 6 A in 0.2 s, the induced EMF in the other coil is:
solution: Induced EMF ε = -M(dI/dt). Given M = 0.5 H, dI = 4 A, dt = 0.2 s. ε = 0.5 × (4/0.2) = 0.5 × 20 = 10 V

question: The electric field at a distance of 20 cm from a point charge of 8 μC is:
Water flows through a horizontal tube with velocities 1 m/s and 4 m/s at two different sections having areas in the ratio 4:1. The pressure difference between the sections is (ρ = 1000 kg/m³):
solution: From continuity: A₁v₁ = A₂v₂, which is satisfied. Using Bernoulli: P₁ + (1/2)ρv₁² = P₂ + (1/2)ρv₂². P₁ - P₂ = (1/2)ρ(v₂² - v₁²) = (1/2) × 1000 × (16 - 1) = 500 × 15 = 7500 Pa

question: A wire of length 2 m and cross-sectional area 10⁻⁶ m² is stretched by 2 mm under a force of 100 N. Young's modulus of the material is:
solution: Young's modulus Y = (F/A)/(ΔL/L) = (FL)/(AΔL). Given F = 100 N, L = 2 m, A = 10⁻⁶ m², ΔL = 2 × 10⁻³ m. Y = (100 × 2)/(10⁻⁶ × 2 × 10⁻³) = 200/(2 × 10⁻⁹) = 1 × 10¹¹ N/m²

question: A coil of self-inductance 2 H carries a current that varies with time as I = 3t². The induced EMF at t = 2 s is:
solution: Induced EMF ε = -L(dI/dt). Given I = 3t², dI/dt = 6t. At t = 2 s, dI/dt = 12 A/s. ε = 2 × 12 = 24 V

question: A soap bubble of radius 3 cm is blown. The work done in blowing the bubble if surface tension is 0.03 N/m is:
solution: Work done = T × ΔA = T × (2 × 4πr²) (factor 2 for two surfaces). W = 0.03 × 8π × (0.03)² = 0.03 × 8π × 0.0009 = 6.78 × 10⁻⁴ J

question: In a common emitter amplifier, the current gain β = 100. If the collector current is 10 mA, the base current is:
solution: Current gain β = Ic/Ib. Given β = 100 and Ic = 10 mA. Therefore Ib = Ic/β = 10/100 = 0.1 mA

question: In a single slit diffraction pattern, the first minimum is observed at 30° with slit width 0.5 mm. The wavelength of light used is:
solution: For first minimum: a sinθ = λ. Given a = 0.5 mm = 5 × 10⁻⁴ m, θ = 30°. λ = 5 × 10⁻⁴ × sin30° = 5 × 10⁻⁴ × 0.5 = 2.5 × 10⁻⁴ m = 250 nm

question: A thin uniform rod of length L and mass M has moment of inertia about an axis perpendicular to the rod through its center:
solution: For a uniform rod about perpendicular axis through center, moment of inertia I = ML²/12

question: A disc of moment of inertia 4 kg·m² rotating with angular velocity 10 rad/s is placed on another stationary disc of moment of inertia 2 kg·m². The final angular velocity of the system is:
solution: By conservation of angular momentum: I₁ω₁ = (I₁ + I₂)ω. Given I₁ = 4 kg·m², ω₁ = 10 rad/s, I₂ = 2 kg·m². ω = (4 × 10)/(4 + 2) = 40/6 = 6.67 rad/s

question: A mass of 0.5 kg is attached to a spring of force constant 200 N/m. The time period of oscillation is:
In a balanced Wheatstone bridge, three resistors are 10 Ω, 20 Ω, and 30 Ω. The fourth resistor is:
solution: In balanced Wheatstone bridge: P/Q = R/S. Given P = 10 Ω, Q = 20 Ω, R = 30 Ω. Therefore 10/20 = 30/S, giving S = 60 Ω

question: An X-ray photon of wavelength 0.1 nm scatters at 90° from a free electron. The wavelength shift is (Compton wavelength = 0.00243 nm):
solution: Compton shift Δλ = λc(1 - cosθ). Given θ = 90°, λc = 0.00243 nm. Δλ = 0.00243 × (1 - 0) = 0.00243 nm

question: An electric dipole of moment 2 × 10⁻⁸ C·m is placed in a uniform electric field of 10⁵ N/C. The maximum torque experienced is:
solution: Maximum torque τ = pE (when θ = 90°). Given p = 2 × 10⁻⁸ C·m, E = 10⁵ N/C. τ = 2 × 10⁻⁸ × 10⁵ = 2 × 10⁻³ N·m

question: 100 g of water at 80°C is mixed with 200 g of water at 20°C. The final temperature of the mixture is:
A satellite orbits Earth at height equal to Earth's radius. If orbital velocity at Earth's surface is v₀, the orbital velocity at this height is:
solution: Orbital velocity v = √(GM/r). At height h = R, r = 2R. v = √(GM/2R) = (1/√2)√(GM/R) = v₀/√2

question: An RL circuit with R = 10 Ω and L = 5 H is connected to a 100 V DC source. The time constant and initial rate of change of current are:
solution: Time constant τ = L/R = 5/10 = 0.5 s. Initial rate (dI/dt)₀ = V/L = 100/5 = 20 A/s

question: An electron is accelerated through a potential difference of 100 V. Its de Broglie wavelength is approximately:
A Carnot engine operates between 500 K and 300 K. Its efficiency is:
solution: Efficiency of Carnot engine η = 1 - T₂/T₁ = 1 - 300/500 = 1 - 0.6 = 0.4 = 40%

question: A point charge q is placed inside a conducting spherical shell of inner radius a and outer radius b. The electric field at distance r from the center (a < r < b) is:
solution: Inside the conductor (between a and b), the electric field is zero because charges redistribute on the inner surface to cancel the field

question: A ball of mass 0.5 kg moving at 20 m/s strikes a wall and bounces back with the same speed. The impulse received by the ball is:
solution: Impulse = Change in momentum = m(v₂ - v₁) = 0.5(20 - (-20)) = 0.5 × 40 = 20 N·s

question: Light travels from medium A (refractive index 1.5) to medium B at critical angle of 45°. The refractive index of medium B is:
solution: At critical angle: nA sinθc = nB. Given nA = 1.5, θc = 45°. 1.5 × sin45° = nB. nB = 1.5 × 0.707 = 1.06

question: A wire carrying current of 10 A is bent into a circular loop of radius 10 cm. The magnetic field at the center is:
solution: Magnetic field at center B = μ₀I/(2R) = (4π × 10⁻⁷ × 10)/(2 × 0.1) = 2π × 10⁻⁵ = 6.28 × 10⁻⁵ T

question: If the radius of Earth decreases by 1% keeping mass constant, the escape velocity will:
solution: vₑ = √(2GM/R), so vₑ ∝ 1/√R. When R decreases by 1%, vₑ increases by 0.5%

question: A force of 10 N acts on a lever arm of length 50 cm at 30° to it. The torque produced is:
A capacitor of 100 μF is charged to 10 V and then connected across a resistor of 1 kΩ. The time taken for the voltage to drop to 3.68 V is:
solution: V = V₀e^(-t/RC). When V = V₀/e = V₀ × 0.368, t = RC = time constant. RC = 10³ × 100 × 10⁻⁶ = 0.1 s

question: Unpolarized light of intensity I₀ passes through two polarizers with axes at 60° to each other. The transmitted intensity is:
solution: After first polarizer: I₁ = I₀/2. After second polarizer: I₂ = I₁cos²60° = (I₀/2) × (1/2)² = (I₀/2) × (1/4) = I₀/8

question: A circular coil of 100 turns and radius 5 cm carries a current of 2 A. The magnetic moment is:
solution: Magnetic moment M = NIA = 100 × 2 × π(0.05)² = 200 × π × 0.0025 = 0.5π = 1.57 A·m²

question: For a metal with work function 3 eV, light of wavelength 300 nm is incident. The stopping potential is:
A liquid of density 800 kg/m³ is filled in a tank to a height of 5 m. The pressure at the bottom is (g = 10 m/s²):
solution: Pressure P = ρgh = 800 × 10 × 5 = 40000 Pa = 40 kPa

question: A capacitor of 50 μF is charged to 200 V. The energy stored is:
In hydrogen atom, the ratio of radii of second and first Bohr orbits is:
solution: Radius rₙ ∝ n². Therefore r₂/r₁ = (2²)/(1²) = 4/1 = 4:1

question: A concave lens of focal length 20 cm forms an image at 10 cm from the lens. The object distance is:
Power is transmitted at 200 V through a wire of resistance 2 Ω. If the transmission voltage is doubled, the power loss becomes:
solution: Power loss = I²R. For constant power P = VI, I ∝ 1/V. When V doubles, I becomes half. Therefore power loss becomes (1/2)² = 1/4 times

question: A car takes a turn of radius 100 m with speed 72 km/h. The angle of banking required for no friction is (g = 10 m/s²):
solution: v = 72 km/h = 20 m/s. For banking without friction: tanθ = v²/(rg) = (20)²/(100 × 10) = 400/1000 = 0.4. Therefore θ = tan⁻¹(0.4)

question: In a damped oscillation, the amplitude reduces to half in 10 s. After 20 s, the amplitude will be:
solution: Amplitude A = A₀e^(-bt). After 10 s, A = A₀/2. After 20 s (two half-lives), A = A₀/4 = one-fourth of initial

question: A transformer has 100 turns in primary and 400 turns in secondary. If input voltage is 230 V, output voltage is:
A straight wire of length 1 m carries current 5 A. The magnetic field at a perpendicular distance of 0.1 m from its midpoint is:
An inclined plane makes an angle of 30° with horizontal. The mechanical advantage for moving a load up is:
solution: Mechanical advantage MA = 1/sinθ = 1/sin30° = 1/0.5 = 2

question: The minimum wavelength of X-rays produced when electrons are accelerated through 12.4 kV is:
Two tuning forks produce 4 beats per second. If frequency of one is 256 Hz, the frequency of other can be:
solution: Beat frequency = |f₁ - f₂| = 4 Hz. If f₁ = 256 Hz, then f₂ = 256 ± 4 = 252 Hz or 260 Hz

question: A parallel plate capacitor has plate area 100 cm² and separation 2 mm. The capacitance is (ε₀ = 8.85 × 10⁻¹² F/m):
A satellite orbits Earth at height 400 km. If Earth's radius is 6400 km and g = 10 m/s², the orbital period is approximately:
A nucleus has mass defect of 0.5 amu. The binding energy in MeV is:
solution: Binding energy = Δm × c² = Δm × 931 MeV (per amu). Given Δm = 0.5 amu. BE = 0.5 × 931 = 465.5 ≈ 465 MeV

question: A wire of length 10 m and cross-section 2 mm² has resistance 20 Ω. The resistivity is:
A black body at 3000 K emits radiation with maximum intensity at wavelength 966.7 nm. At what temperature will the maximum shift to 483.35 nm?
A double convex lens has radii of curvature 20 cm each and refractive index 1.5. Its focal length is:
500 g of water is heated from 20°C to 100°C. The heat required is (specific heat = 4.2 J/g°C):
A spring of force constant 200 N/m is stretched by 5 cm. The work done is:
A conductor of width 2 cm carrying current 5 A is placed in a magnetic field of 0.5 T perpendicular to it. If the Hall voltage is 1 mV, the number density of charge carriers is:
A string of length 1 m fixed at both ends vibrates in its third harmonic with frequency 300 Hz. The wave velocity is:
solution: For nth harmonic: f = nv/(2L). Given n = 3, f = 300 Hz, L = 1 m. 300 = 3v/(2 × 1). v = 600/3 = 200 m/s

question: Two bodies at temperatures 400 K and 300 K radiate energy. The ratio of their emitted power is:
solution: By Stefan's law: P ∝ T⁴. P₁/P₂ = (T₁/T₂)⁴ = (400/300)⁴ = (4/3)⁴ = 256/81

question: In a potentiometer experiment, a cell of EMF 1.5 V balances at 300 cm. When a resistance of 5 Ω is connected across the cell, it balances at 250 cm. The internal resistance is:
The output of a NAND gate is 0 when:

options.C: One input is 0 and other is 1

solution: NAND gate gives output 0 only when both inputs are 1. In all other cases, output is 1

question: A radioactive substance decays to 1/16th of its initial amount in 40 days. Its half-life is:
Two lenses of focal lengths 20 cm and -10 cm are placed in contact. The equivalent focal length is:
The rate of heat flow through a rod is 10 W. If the rod is cut into two equal parts and connected in parallel, the rate becomes:
solution: Rate of heat flow Q/t = kAΔθ/L. When cut in half and placed parallel: Area doubles, length halves. New rate = 4 × original = 40 W

question: An LCR circuit has L = 1 H, C = 1 μF. The resonant frequency is:
solution: Resonant frequency f = 1/(2π√LC) = 1/(2π√(1 × 10⁻⁶)) = 1/(2π × 10⁻³) = 159 Hz

question: A charge of 10⁻⁸ C is enclosed by a closed surface. The electric flux through the surface is:
solution: By Gauss's law: φ = q/ε₀ = (10⁻⁸)/(8.85 × 10⁻¹²) = 1.13 × 10³ N·m²/C

question: A projectile has maximum range R on a horizontal plane. For the same speed, if it is projected on an inclined plane of angle 30°, the range along the plane is:
solution: Range on inclined plane at angle α for maximum range condition: R' = R cos α = R cos 30° = R√3/2

question: A copper wire of cross-section 2 mm² carries current 2 A. If electron density is 8.5 × 10²⁸ m⁻³, the drift velocity is:
solution: Drift velocity vd = I/(neA) = 2/(8.5 × 10²⁸ × 1.6 × 10⁻¹⁹ × 2 × 10⁻⁶) = 7.35 × 10⁻⁵ m/s

question: A ray passes through a prism of refracting angle 60° at minimum deviation. If refractive index is √2, the angle of minimum deviation is:
The energy density in a magnetic field of 2 T is:
solution: Energy density u = B²/(2μ₀) = (2)²/(2 × 4π × 10⁻⁷) = 4/(8π × 10⁻⁷) = 1.59 × 10⁶ J/m³
